io7jz.question: Above which speed, do the armed ground spoilers extend automatically upon a rejected T/O?

options.text: 80 kt
72 kt
55 kt
90 kt

l1mp1.question: ALTERNATE LAW - high-speed stability: Above VMO or MMO, _____________ is introduced to avoid an excessive increase in speed.

options.text: A thrust reduction demand
A nose up demand
A thrust increase demand
A nose down demand

e161.question: In order to avoid overshooting the altitude, due to speedbrake retraction in ALT* mode, retract the speedbrakes at least _________ before the selected altitude.

02u0z.question: Which memory items define to retract the speedbrakes?

options.text: Unreliable speed indication, GPWS warnings, Stall recovery
Stall recovery, Loss of braking, Emergency descent
GPWS warnings, Emergency descent, TCAS warnings
Unreliable speed indications, Windshear ahead, Stall warning at lift-off

93xdu.question: Which statement about landing with slats or flaps jammed is correct?

options.text: The flap lever is useless due to jammend slats and flaps and have to maintain at the last selected position
The autopilot must not be used for this kind of abnormal configuration
The autopilot may be used down to 500ft AGL. As it is tuned for abnormal configurations, ist behavior can be less than optimum and must be monitored
The autopilot may be used up to the maximum indicated landing capability with possibility for autoland if indicated

qnyvii.question: Is there any crosswind limitation for landing with jammend flight controls?

options.text: Yes, 20kt for LANDING WITH SLATS OR FLAPS JAMMED
No, there are no crosswind limits for a landing with jammend flight controls
Yes, 15 kt for RUDDER JAM
Yes, 25 kt for F/CTL L(R) SIDESTICK FAULT

qf2uc.question: Which statement about the FLAP SYSTEM is correct?

options.text: The pilot cannot select an intermediate lever position
Before selecting any position, the pilot must pull the lever out of the detent
Balks at position 1 and 3 prevent the pilot from calling for excessive flap/slat travel with a single action
All answers are correct
Electrically-controlled and Hydraulically-activated
Hydraulically-controlled and Electrically-activated
Electrically-controlled and Mechanically-activated
Mechanically-controlled and Electrically-activated

trcmr.question: How many flight control computers process pilot and autopilot inputs?

options.text: 7 (2 ELACs, 3 SECs, 2 FACs)
6 (2 ELACs, 3 SECs, 1 FAC)
5 (2 ELACs, 2 SECs, 1 FAC)
4 (2 ELACS, 1 SEC, 1 FAC)

2z469.question: To control the aircraft about the roll axis the following Flight controls will are used:

options.text: Aileron, rudder and spoilers
One aileron and four spoilers on each wing
Aileron and rudder
Aileronsonly

lshla.question: Mechanical control of the flight controls is available for?

options.text: Elevator and aileron
Rudder and elevator
Stabilizer and rudder
Aileron and stabilizer

g69p2.question: What is the ALPHA/SPEED LOCK FUNCTION ?

options.text: This function inhibits flap retraction at HIGH angles-of-attack and LOW speeds
This function inhibits slat retraction at LOW angles-of-attack and LOW speeds
This function inhibits flap retraction at HIGH angles-of-attack and HIGH speeds
This function inhibits slat retraction at HIGH angles-of-attack and LOW speeds

jxxm9.question: With the autopilot engaged, the FMGC computes the rudder trim orders. The rudder trim rotary switch and the rudder trim reset pushbutton_____________.

options.text: Are not active
Are active as long as the flight control system is in NORMAL LAW
Operate with limited range (Dependig on the aircraft speed within the envelope)
Are active as long as the flight control system is in ALTERNATE LAW only

j26tk.question: TAKEOFF IN CONFIGURATION 1 + F If the flight crew does not select configuration zero after takeoff, the flaps retract automatically at ___ kt:

options.text: 200 kt
205 kt
210 kt
220 kt

4vhza.question: What is the mechanical back-up in the flight controls system?

options.text: It consists of cables between the cockpit controls and the flight controls surfaces in the pitch and roll axis in case of a total loss of both ELAC computers
It enables the pilot to control the aircraft during a temporary complete loss of electrical power. It does this in pitch by manually applying trim to the THS
It enables the pilot to control the aircraft when the pitch attitude exceeds 50° nose up or 30° nose down and when bank angle exceeds 125°
It enables the pilot to control the aircraft during ELEC EMER configuration. The PFDs display USE MAN PITCH TRIM

yyq8l.question: RUD TRIM RESET pb: By pushing the RESET pb on the ground, the zero trim position is ordered at 1.5 °/s. After the reset, an indication of up to ___ ° (L or R) may be observed in the rudder trim position indication:

5znkq.question: Mechanical backup enables the pilot to control the aircraft during a temporary complete__________.

options.text: Loss of both engines
Loss of hydraulic power
Loss of electrical power
Loss of rudder control

x5iny.question: In normal operation, which hydraulic system(s) drive the elevator jacks? (Not in damping mode)

options.text: Yellow and Green
Yellow and Blue
Green and Blue
Yellow only

a48j2.question: Which spoilers are used as speedbrakes?

options.text: 1,2 and 3
2,3and4
3,4and5

6dqj6h.question: Which spoilers are used as ground spoilers?

options.text: 1,2and3
2,3and4
3,4and5

vedf8.question: Four hydraulically-operated Wingtip brakes (WTBs) are installed to lock the flaps or slats in case of:

options.text: Asymmetry, mechanism overspeed and slow movement
Asymmetry, mechanism overspeed, symmetrical runaway and uncommanded movement of the surfaces
Asymmetry and overspeed only
Symmetrical runaway and uncommanded movement only

0r4sd.question: Under NORMAL LAW, when the angle-of-attack becomes greater than ____, the system switches elevator control from normal mode to a protection mode, in which the angle-of-attack is proportional to sidestick deflection.

options.text: ALPHA FLOOR
ALPHAPROT
ALPHAMAX
ALPHAPROT+1°

915av.question: When is the ALPHA FLOOR function activated?

options.text: Under NORMAL LAW with the A/THR available from lift-off to 100ft RA before landing
ALPHA is greater than ALPHA FLOOR
Sidestick deflection is greater than 14° nose up, with either the pitch attitude or the angle-of-attack protection active
All answers are correct

av4nu.question: Which of the following statements, describing the ground spoilers function during a rejected takeoff, is correct?

options.text: If the ground spoilers are armed and the speed exceeds 72kts the ground spoilers will automatically extend as soon as one thrust lever are reset to idle
If the ground spoilers are armed and the speed exceeds 72kts the ground spoilers will automatically extend as soon as both thrust levers are reset to idle
If the ground spoilers are not armed and the speed exceeds 72kts the ground spoiler will automatically extend as soon as both thrust levers are reset to idle
If the ground spoilers are not armed and the speed exceeds 72kts the ground spoilers will never extend

gqnel.question: The maximum rudder deflection that the rudder travel limiter will allow under normal conditions is:

options.text: 25° rudder deflection up to a speed of 160kts
15° rudder deflection up to a speed of 150kts
45° rudder deflection up to a speed of 160kts
25° rudder deflection at a speed of 300kts

9ycuh.question: Normal Law will help protect the aircraft against an exceedance of the following values:

options.text: Load factor: +2.5g to -1g for clean configuration, Pitch attitude: 25° nose up in CONF FULL, Bank angle: 67° with full lateral sidestick deflection
Load factor: +2.0g to 0g for clean configuration, Pitch attitude: 25° nose up in CONF FULL, Bank angle: 67° with full sidestick deflection
Load factor: +2.5g to -1g for clean configuration, Pitch attitude: 30° nose up in CONF FULL, Bank angle: 67° with full sidestick deflection
Load factor: +2.5g to -1g for clean configuration, Pitch attitude: 25° nose up in CONF FULL, Bank angle: 45° with full sidestick deflection
A pilot can at any time reactivate a deactivated stick by momentarily pressing the takeover P/B
For latching the priority condition it is recommended to press the takeover P/B for more than 40 seconds
If the aircraft is on the ground and commencing its takeoff run and one stick is deactivated, this triggers the takeoff “CONFIG” warning
All answers are correct

ky4m4.question: A spoiler panel amber triangle symbol on the ECAM F/CTL page indicates that

options.text: Spoiler is missing
Spoiler fault deflected
Spoiler fault retracted
Spoiler position not valid

699hx.question: Which of the following statements is true about the sidesticks and their operation?

options.text: The only way to deactivate the solenoid-operated detent locking both sidesticks in the neutral position with the autopilot engaged is by pressing the autopilot disconnect and sidestick takeover pushbutton
If the aircraft is on the ground and commencing its take off with one stick deactivated, the takeoff CONFIG warning will be activated
A green light comes on in front of the pilot who has taken priority, if the other stick is in the neutral position
If both pilots press their takeover push buttons, the pilot that presses first gets priority

q3bfz.question: Which of the following statements is true about the sidesticks and their operation?

options.text: All answers are correct
In the event of simultaneous input on both sidesticks the two green SIDE STICK PRIORITY lights on the glareshield come on and DUAL INPUT voice message is activated
In a priority situation a red light comes on in front of the pilot whose stick is deactivated
In a priority situation a green light comes on in front of the pilot who has taken control, if the other stick is not in the neutral position (to indicate a potential and unwanted control demand)

je2wa.question: f, in flight, you experience ELAC or SEC malfunctions, can you reset more than one computer at a time?

options.text: No, Do not reset more than one computer at the same time unless instructed to do so
Yes, Flight control computers are redundant an can reset by more than one at the same time, this reduces the time to reset/recover the flight control computers
At commander's discretion, if he deems it necessary for the safety of the flight
Yes, if engine No. 2 is switched off

inoeu.question: Which of the following statements is true about the BANK ANGLE PROTECTION?

options.text: Inside the normal flight envelope, the system maintains positive spiral stability for bank angles above 45°
Inside the normal flight envelope, the bank angle would be 67° and no further if both pilots were to hold full lateral sidestick deflection in the same direction
If the angle of attack protection is active with a sidestick maintained at full lateral deflection, the protection will limit the bank angle to 33°
f the bank angle exceeds the value of 67°, the autopilot disconnects and the FD bars disappear

oij55.question: Depending on the failures occuring to the flight control system or on its peripherals, control reconfigurations to certain levels can occur. These are:

options.text: Primary law, secondary law and emergency law
Normal law, abnormal law and emergency law
Direct law, normal law and G-load law
Alternate law, direct law and mechanical back-up

rczg8.question: On the A319 and A320,the flight controls are comprised of, among others:

options.text: 5 slat surfaces per wing, 8 spoilers, 2 cruise ailerons, 1 rudder surface
8 slat surfaces, 10 spoilers, 2 ailerons, 1 rudder surface
8 slat surfaces, 2 flap surfaces, 2 rudder surfaces, 4 split elevator surfaces
10 slat surfaces, 4 flap surfaces, 1 rudder surface, 2 elevator surfaces
At 50 ft AGL, the THS is frozen, the normal flight mode changes to flare mode, the attitude at 50ft is memorized and it becomes the initial reference for pitch attitude control
As the aircraft descends through 50 ft AGL, the system begins to reduce the pitch attitude to -2° nose down over a period of 8 seconds
To flare the aircraft, the pilot must pull on the sidestick because the THS starts to trim to 0° when passing 30 ft
It is a mode that is only active when an autoland is performed

bih7vg.question: If the F/O presses the take over pb constantly...

options.text: The Capt is unable to re-activate his side stick.
The Capt’s side stick is still active. It will be de-activated after 40 secs.
The Capt can re-activate his side stick by pressing the take over pb for more than 40 secs.
The Capt can re-activate his side stick immediately by pressing his take over pb.

k2rkj.question: Let’s assume the F/O presses his take over pb and releases it after more than 40s.

options.text: The Capt’s side stick is de-activated unless he presses his take over pb
The Capt is unable to re-activate his side stick for the rest of the flight
Both side sticks are active
The Capt’s side stick is active as long as the F/O’s side stick is in neutral position

ip90j.question: With either AP engaged, which statement is true?

options.text: A Solenoid-operated detent locks both sidesticks in the neutral position. The lock cannot be overiden
Both side sticks are de-activated until the AP is disengaged
A Solenoid-operated detent locks both sidesticks in the neutral position. If the pilot applies a force above a given threshold the stick becomes free but the autopilot will remain engaged
A Solenoid-operated detent locks both sidesticks in the neutral position. If the pilot applies a force above a given threshold the stick becomes free and the autopilot disengages

sllod.question: Is full rudder deflection available during all flight regimes?

options.text: No, except in approach with flaps 1 selected
No, it is limited as a function of speed and gradually reduces as speed increases
No, it is limited as a function of speed and gradually increases as speed increases
Yes, except in level cruise flight

7kxny.question: At touchdown with reverse selected and only one landing gear strut is compressed, how will the ground spoilers extend?

options.text: Fully
The spoilers do not extend, unti both struts are compressed.
Partially, until both main landing gear struts are compressed

8rcy7.question: How many actuators are provided to control the ailerons (both) and how many hydraulic sources supply these actuators?

options.text: 2 hydraulic sources (GREEN & BLUE) with 4 servojacks
1 hydraulic source (GREEN) with 2 servojacks
3 hydraulic (GREEN, YELLOW, BLUE) sources with 4 servojacks
3 hydraulic sources (GREEN, YELLOW, BLUE) with 6 servojacks

iw8fv.question: The message WING TIP BRK ON appears on the E/WD. What happend and what are the consequences?

options.text: Wingtip brakes (WTBs), activated in case of asymmetry, mechanism overspeed, symmetrical runaway or uncommented movement of surfaces. They cannot be released in flight
To reduce structural stress due to failure of partial flight controlsystem, the slat and flap movement is being slowed down through the Wingtip brakes (WTBs)
To avoid asymmetry, the outer slats are locked in their present position only
The flaps and slats are locked with the Wingtip brakes (WTBs) because of a detected leak in the hydraulic system to avoid spilling hydrailic fluid. For safety reasons a reset is possible in flight

esvl.question: Are there any control surfaces with a mechanical backup?

options.text: Yes, the ailerons
Yes, the spoilers
Yes, the THS and the rudder
No, there aren’t any control surfaces with mechanical backup

n8odt.question: In Normal Law, what is the maximum bank angle you can reach with the side stick fully deflected?

options.text: There is no bank limitation.

wvnhi.question: To fly a coordinated turn under NORMAL LAW..

options.text: No pilot induced rudder inputs are required
The pilot has to center the sideslip indicator with the rudder pedals
Only little rudder inputs are required by the pilot
The flight computer compensate the yaw automatic and using the spoiler surfaces only. No rudder movement under normal conditions during flight

sokaf.question: If both pilots deflect their side sticks fully back...

options.text: The “pitch up” order is twice as high as with only one stick deflected.
The “pitch up” order is 1.5 times higher than with only one stick deflected.
No inputs are sent to the flight control computers unless one pilot presses the take over pb on his stick.
The “pitch up” order is equal to a single maximum stick deflection.

85yok.question: Seven flight control computers process pilot and autopilot inputs. 3 SECs are used for:

options.text: Spoiler Control
Elevator Control
Stabilizer Control
Aileron Control

ur2tlh.question: n NORMAL LAW, if one side stick is rapidly pulled fully back, can the aircraft’s maximum allowable “G” load be exceeded?

options.text: Yes. Because of that, rapid side stick deflection must never be made
Yes, until maximum pitch attitude is reached
No. At maximum “G” load, the side sticks are de-activated for 3 seconds
No. The load factor limitation overrides side stick commands to avoid excessive “G” loads

ydsdog.question: Regarding Alternate law and Low speed stability: An artificial low speed stability replaces the normal angle-of-attack protection. It is available for all slat/flap configurations, and the low speed stability is active from ___________ above stall warning speed, depending on the aircraft's gross weight and slats/flaps configuration.

options.text: about 10 knots up to about 15 knots.
about 5 knots up to about 10 knots.
about 5 knots up to about 15 knots.

5mv6zf.question: Rudder control is electrical for yaw damping and trim.

options.text: Yes
No

wlpb1.question: Which law does the system apply in the case of an extraordinary unpredictable external event (e.g. mid- air collision)? The flight parameters may go far beyond the limits of the protected envelope.

options.text: ABNORMAL ATTITUDE LAW
DIRECT LAW
ALTERNATE LAW
ALTERNATE LAW WITHOUT REDUCED PROTECTIONS

i2uye.question: Pitch Control Protections: The normal law protects the aircraft throughout the flight Control envelope, as follows:

options.text: Manoeuvre protection • pitch attitude protection • high speed protection
Manoeuvre protection • high angle of attack protection • high speed protection
Load Factor limitation • pitch attitude Protection • high AOA protection • low speed protection
Load Factor limitation • pitch attitude Protection • high AOA protection • high speed protection

9rqp2.question: In alternate law only the yaw damping function is available. Damper authority is limited to _______ of rudder deflection.

options.text: ±3°
±5°
±7°

4s9qcf.question: How many flight control computers process pilot and autopilot inputs according to normal, alternate, or direct flight control laws?

options.text: Five
Six
Seven

w848k.question: When the aircraft has recovered from its abnormal attitude, the flight control laws in effect are: (more than one answer may be correct)

options.text: In pitch: alternate law with no protection and with autotrim.
In roll: direct law is active
In yaw: alternate law without protection or yaw dampening
A load factor demand with no protection.
A direct side stick to elevator relationship.
A direct side stick to elevator relationship with auto trim operation.
Achieved through the THS using manual trim control.

eoeczj.question: The yaw damping and turn coordination functions are automatic. The _____ compute yaw orders for coordinating turns and damping yaw oscillations, and transmit them to the _____.

options.text: FACs / ELACs
ELACs / FACs
ELACs / SECs
SECs / FACs
Pitch control is provided by FAC 1 or FAC 2
Pitch control can only be achieved from the trim wheel
The elevator and pitch trim are controlled by SEC 1 or 2
The pitch trim is frozen and pitch control is achieved via FAC 1 or FAC 2 by elevator only

wug0z.question: When both sticks are moved in the same or opposite direction:

options.text: The surface movement is proportional to the last stick deflected.
The surface movement is proportional to the first stick deflected.
The left stick has a priority.
The system adds the signals of both pilots algebraically.
Spoilers 1 to 5 act as ground spoilers.
Speed brake function: Spoilers 1.2.3. Deploy
Roll function: ailerons + spoilers 4 and 5 deploy

7fefv.question: In Direct Law aircraft pitch is trimmed:

options.text: Automatically controlled by the FAC s
Manually controlled by the handwheel
Pitch trim is not available
Automatically controlled by the ELAC s or SEC s depending on the failure

c48vd.question: In Direct Law... (more than one answer is correct)

options.text: the Alpha floor function is inoperative.
the pilot must trim manually.
overspeed and stall warnings are available as for alternate law.

09gnw.question: Under reduced protections, the PFD speed scale is modified to show a black/red barber pole below the stall warning.

c2gd9.question: Flying in ALTERNATE LAW WITH REDUCED PROTECTIONS, the AP will disconnect, if____________

options.text: Speed exceeds VMO/MMO or if the bank angle exceeds 30°
Speed exceeds VMO/MMO +4kt or if the bank angle exceeds 45°
Speed exceeds VMO/MMO or if the bank angle exceeds 45°
Speed exceeds VMO/MMO +10kt or if the bank angle exceeds 30°

ur2ry.question: What happens if one SFCC is inoperative?

options.text: Nothing.
Flaps and slats operate at half speed.
Flaps system lost.

1drrt.question: How many control modes are there on the elevators servo jacks?

options.text: Two
Three
Four

drotl.question: In flight, if a WTB (wing tip brake) is activated, can it be released?

options.text: Yes
No

sc55y.question: What are the limits for manoeuvre protection in NORMAL LAW:

options.text: + 2.5 g to -1 g clean configuration + 2 g to 0 other configurations
+ 2.5 g to - 2.5 g clean configuration + 2 g to -1 other configurations
+ 2.5 g to 0 clean and + 1 g to -1 g other configurations
+ 1 g to 0 clean and + 2.5 g to -1 g other configurations

belgf.question: A pilot can at any time reactivate a deactivated stick by:

options.text: Momentary pressing the take over push button on the active stick only
By simultaneous pressing of both take over push buttons
Momentarily pressing the takeover push button on either stick
Momentarily pressing the takeover push button on either stick and pressing the SIDE STICK PRIORITY push button on the glareshield

l87tu.question: Inside the normal flight envelope, the system maintains positive spiral static stability for bank angles above:

options.text: 45°
33°
37°

nexrkl.question: When the aircraft is in the in flight mode, NORMAL LAW combines control of the______

options.text: Ailerons, spoilers (except N° 1 spoilers), and rudder (for turn coordination) in the sidestick
Ailerons, spoilers (except N° 5 spoilers), and elevators in the sidestick
Ailerons and spoilers (except N° 1 spoilers) in the sidestick only
Ailerons, spoilers (except N° 3 and 4 spoilers), and rudder (for turn coordination) in the sidestick

atss1.question: If ELAC 1 and ELAC 2 have failed:

options.text: Roll control is provided by ailerons only.
Roll control is provided by aileron and spoilers.
The ailerons revert to the damping mode.

3ormq.question: How many electric motors control the hydraulic motor of the stabilizer?

options.text: Three of Three
Two of Three
One of Three

o308uk.question: If you are flying under NORMAL LAW at an angle of attack more than Alpha Prot, what happens when you release the stick?

options.text: Speed returns to VLS
Speed returns to ALPHA PROT
The angle of attack returns to ALPHA PROT and stays there
Speed returns to ALPHA MAX and stays there

lpfs8.question: When direct law is active, the yaw damping is:

options.text: Degraded.
Lost.

sjahe.question: In pitch alternate law, the flight mode changes to the flare mode when:

options.text: The pilot selects landing gear down.
When flaps selected to 2.
Passing 50 ft.

1cnj3.question: With hydraulic blue system remaining and before landing gear extension, the flight control law in pitch is:

options.text: Law protection lost
Alternte Law
Direct Law
